x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
x-redlock-auth.name: x-redlock-auth

lastModifiedTs.description: Unix timestamp of last modification, in milliseconds

info.description:
With multiple out-of-the-box integration options, you can integrate Prisma Cloud into security 
workflows and technologies that already exist in your organization.

**Note**: For Prisma Cloud integrations with the following, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull):

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

### Integration Configuration

The model for an integration between Prisma Cloud and an external system includes
an **integrationConfig** parameter which is a map of key/value pairs. The
type of integration defines the content of these key/value pairs. See
[Integration Configurations](/api/cloud/api-integration-config) for more information about
integration API request body details, including the **integrationConfig**
request parameter key/value pairs that apply to your specific integration API.
info.title: Prisma Cloud External Integrations API

get.description:
Returns a list of the supported integration types.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/channels"

headers = {"x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/channels \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description:
Returns a list of integrations.

The caller must have one of the following Prisma Cloud roles:

* System Admin
* Account Group Admin
* Account and Cloud Provisioning Admin
* Account Group Read Only

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration?ids=SOME_ARRAY_VALUE&type=SOME_STRING_VALUE&onlyEnabled=SOME_BOOLEAN_VALUE' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Creates a Prisma Cloud integration with an external system. 

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"description":"This is the sample integration","integrationConfig":{"property1":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"},"property2":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"}},"integrationType":"slack","name":"sample-integration"}'

get.description:
Returns the integration with the specified ID.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id}"

headers = {"x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id} \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

patch.description:
Updates the state of an integration. For example, you can enable or disable
an integration.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request PATCH \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"enabled":true}'

put.description:
Updates an integration.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request PUT \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"description":"This is the sample integration","enabled":true,"integrationConfig":{"property1":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"},"property2":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"}},"name":"sample-integration"}'

delete.description:
Deletes an integration.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id}"

headers = {"x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"}

response = requests.request("DELETE", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/{id} \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Runs a test of the integration for the specified data.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/test?id=SOME_STRING_VALUE' \
  --header 'content-type: application/json' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE' \
  --data '{"integrationConfig":{"property1":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"},"property2":{"webhookUrl":"https://hooks.slack.com/abcdef"}},"integrationType":"slack","name":"sample-integration"}'

get.description:
Returns a list of security-hub-enabled AWS regions for the specified AWS account.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

get.summary: Get Security Hub Enabled Regions by AWS Account ID

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/securityhub/regions/{accountId}"

headers = {"x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/securityhub/regions/{accountId} \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description:
Returns the security-hub-enabled AWS account name and ID for the specified Prisma ID.

The caller must have a Prisma Cloud role of System Admin.

**Note**: This request does not support Prisma Cloud integrations with the following:

* Okta
* Qualys
* Tenable

For requests that support integration with the systems above, see [Integrations Pull](/api/cloud/cspm/integrations-pull).

parameters.description:
Prisma ID. Your Prisma ID is available either from the response object of your 
[API request to log in](/api/cloud/cspm/login#operation/app-login) or 
from the licensing information in the Prisma Cloud console.
parameters.name: prismaId

get.summary: Get Security Hub Enabled AWS Accounts

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/securityhub/accounts"

headers = {"x-redlock-auth": "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/api/v1/tenant/{prismaId}/integration/securityhub/accounts \
